title: Europeans draw divergent lessons from Trump's threats over Greenland
subhead: While the crisis over Greenland, coveted by Donald Trump, has prompted some EU member states to consider strategic autonomy, others still don't believe Europe can defend itself without the US.

title: 'It is urgent to prepare for difficult times. France's 2026 budget does exactly the opposite'
Trump nominates Kevin Warsh to head US Federal Reserve
Trump administration orders arrest of ex-CNN anchor covering Minneapolis protests
subhead: Attorney General Pam Bondi said in a post on X that Don Lemon and several other people had been arrested on unspecified federal charges in connection with what she called a 'coordinated attack' on the Cities Church in St. Paul, the twin city of Minneapolis.

title: China's crackdown on a village of defiant Christians
subhead: Videos, testimonies and satellite footage obtained by Le Monde reveal the scale of the repression of part of the Chinese Christian community.

title: Beehives, yachts and cattle: How France manages 'atypical' seized assets
subhead: As caseloads surge, France's asset recovery agency is grappling with an influx of unusual seizures, costly to store, tricky to sell and sometimes a legal maze.

title: 'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhead: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

UN faces 'imminent financial collapse,' Guterres says

Syrian government and Kurds announce an agreement
Luigi Mangione will not face death penalty over CEO murder, judge rules
US skier Lindsey Vonn says Olympic dream 'not over' after crash

France's economy grew slightly more than expected in 2025
'The only thing left to do is leave': Cuba pushed to the brink
subhead: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (2/3). Since the wave of unrest that swept the country in 2021, more than two million Cubans have fled. Those who remain on the island scrape by with varying degrees of success, as the exorbitant price of basic goods has become a source of inequality between those with nothing and those with access to foreign currency.

title: Denmark's long and difficult reckoning with America's abandonment
subhead: Since the end of the Cold War, the Scandinavian kingdom pursued a 'super-Atlanticist' strategy in hopes that the US would come to its aid when needed. Now, trust between Washington and Copenhagen has been broken.

title: 'For sure': Two impromptu words by Macron go viral
subhead: During his speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the French president delivered a common English phrase – in a strong accent – that achieved global fame.

title: The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
Europe: 'A new social federalism must be invented as the response of democratic states to empires'
France's under-15 social media ban: 'Parents are being asked to do the dirty work that the government has refused to impose'
